alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... Modifications to the fine points of the theory can then be proposed and debated, but the backbone structure of the theory is set.  That framework has already been firmly established.

An inherent flaw lurking in this method is: What if your 'obviously correct,' basic, starting-point presumption is wrong?"
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - What if Your Obviously Correct Starting Point Presumption is Wrong? - Part 2
